title: Hollyoaks star confirms John Paul and Craig 'reunion' will be addressed as he returns
text:

Hollyoaks actor James Sutton has revealed what happened between John Paul McQueen and his ex Craig Dean will be addressed when his character returns.

The actor left the role of John Paul in 2017, having returned five years earlier after a split from Craig - while the pair had a son named Matthew in their time away from the village.

Craig and JP, known to loyal fans as McDean, had initially left the soap together in a 'sunset ending' back in 2008 so fans were devastated to learn it had not worked out.

But fresh hope was restored when John Paul left two years ago, and he received a text from his ex before he looked out of the window of a plane to see a sunset - a nod to their initial exit all those years ago.

(Image: Channel 4)

Speaking exclusively to Mirror Online as he prepares for another return, actor James has promised all will finally be addressed about what has gone on over the past two years.

Ahead of the soap finally revealing whether the characters did reunite and maybe even reconcile, James remained coy over what exactly would be detailed.

Asked if we would get any news on McDean, he told us: "Yeah... that's all addressed," before remaining quiet on any spoilers.

(Image: Channel 4)

(Image: Channel 4)

Unfortunately those wanting a McDean revival are not going to get one, with James also revealing there are no plans to bring Craig back.

He said: "No, Guy Burnet is busy being brilliant in TV shows in America, but it is addressed, yeah."

So while we won't likely be getting an on-screen reunion, there is some story there involving the two village favourites.

(Image: Channel 4)

As John Paul makes his return soon, he will come face-to-face with his rapist Finn O'Connor who was recently released from prison.

He told us: "We’ve got one big scene coming up. It's a really complicated storyline emotionally.

"We're asking the question, can you rehabilitate someone who’s done something so bad?

"It's not something asked often on telly or in dramas, and it's not without its problems because everyone has their own view . We're leaving it open to the viewer, which is a nice device."

Hollyoaks airs weeknights at 6:30pm on Channel 4, with the next episode at 7pm on E4.
description: EXCLUSIVE: Hollyoaks viewers were convinced John Paul McQueen and ex Craig Dean, known as McDean, had reconciled in 2017
